page.title: 10WICKHAM STREET
page.content: This cluster of houses and a pub are at the junction of A143 and Church road (leading to W'brook) and Denston lane. The parish boundary wavers uncertainly through the group, so that some houses are in W'brook and some in Denston. The pub, the Plumbers Arms, is part in one parish and part in the other. It is said that you order beer in W'brook and they fetch it from Denston. In 1985 two thatched cottages were burnt down. One is being restored with thatching of Norfolk reeds, the other will be replaced by a house with tiled roof. Most of the houses in the area are Suffolk "traditional" in that the rooms are low and the upper rooms within the roof space, with dormer windows.
